meanings.definition: Rapid eye movements from one point of fixation to another.
meanings.sent1: During the movie, her saccades followed the action on the screen.
meanings.sent2: The doctor observed the patient's saccades as part of the eye examination.
meanings.sent3: The saccades of the kitten chasing a laser pointer were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: His saccades across the crowded room reminded me of a busy bee flitting from flower to flower.
meanings.sent5: The saccades of the dancer on stage were so precise, it was like watching a well-choreographed performance.

meanings.definition: A quick, jerky movement of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The sudden saccades of the child watching the bird in flight were noticeable.
meanings.sent2: She experienced saccades when trying to focus on the tiny print.
meanings.sent3: The saccades of the robot's eyes made it seem like it was glitching.
meanings.sent4: His saccades were like a camera trying to autofocus in low light.
meanings.sent5: The saccades of the detective scanning the crime scene were sharp and precise.
